components.description:
A seedling, or a young plant, as a newly sprouted tree. Depicted as a tiny, light-green plant with a short stem and two leaves. Often shown freshly sprung from a small mound of brown earth.

May be used for various content concerning plant life. May also be used as a symbol of spring or representation of various types of new growth.

Not to be confused with ðŸŒ¿ Herb, though their applications may overlap.

Facebook’s seedling previously had three leaves.
components.title: Seedling

A seedling, or a young plant, as a newly sprouted tree. Depicted as a tiny, light-green plant with a short stem and two leaves. Often shown freshly sprung from a small mound of brown earth.

May be used for various content concerning plant life. May also be used as a symbol of spring or representation of various types of new growth.

Not to be confused with ðŸŒ¿ Herb, though their applications may overlap.

title: Seedling

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Plant symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: A seedling, a sign of spring. A new plant of some kind sprouting from the earth, hoping to grow into a large tree, flower or plant if condit http://emojipedia.org/seedling/
emoji_net_data.name: seedling

bn:00094202v: To cause to grow from a seed.
Put forth and grow sprouts or shoots

bn:00070270n: A seedling is a young plant sporophyte developing out of a plant embryo from a seed.
A young plant grown from seed
The first bud, or gemmule, of a young plant; the bud, or growing point, of the embryo, above the cotyledons.
Young plant or tree grown from a seed
Young plants after germination from seeds (sometimes also referred to as sprouts)

bn:00073636n: Â  Traditionally the first of the four seasons of the year in temperate regions, in which plants spring from the ground and trees come into blossom, following winter and preceding summer.
One of the four temperate seasons
The season of spring, between winter and summer.
Traditionally the first of the four seasons, the season of growth with an ever increasing amount of daytime.
Spring is one of the four conventional temperate seasons, following winter and preceding summer.
Spring is one of the four seasons of temperate zones, the transition from winter into summer.

bn:00073667n: A new growth on a plant, whether from seed or other parts.
Any new growth of a plant such as a new branch or a bud

bn:00041433n: A very large and widespread family of Monocotyledoneae, with more than 10.000 species, most of which are herbaceous, but a few are woody. The stems are jointed, the long, narrow leaves originating at the nodes. The flowers are inconspicuous, with a much reduced perianth, and are wind-pollinated or cleistogamous.
Various plants not in family Poaceae that resemble grasses.
Narrow-leaved green herbage: grown as lawns; used as pasture for grazing animals; cut and dried as hay
Grasses, or more technically graminoids, are monocotyledonous, usually herbaceous plants with narrow leaves growing from the base.

bn:00035324n: An organism that is not an animal, especially an organism capable of photosynthesis. Typically a small or herbaceous organism of this kind, rather than a tree.
(botany) a living organism lacking the power of locomotion
Plants considered as a group, especially those of a particular country, region, time, etc.
The plants that inhabit a certain region or environment.
Collectively, the set of all plants.
Inventory of plant species in a given region
Flora is the plant life occurring in a particular region or time, generally the naturally occurring or indigenous -- native plant life.

Any living organism that synthesizes its food from inorganic substances, possesses cellulose cell walls, responds slowly and often permanently to a stimulus, lacks specialized sense organs and nervous system, and has no powers of locomotion.
Species belonging to the plant kingdom.
The plant life characterizing a specific geographic region or environment.
Plants, also called green plants, are multicellular eukaryotes of the kingdom Plantae.
Plants are living organisms belonging to the kingdom Plantae.
